name: Photon Gods
description:
Created for the first ever Flatiron School Game Jam with Michael Carlisle, Lora Johns, and Eric Ma.

Inspired by Feynman diagrams, this game currently functions on a system of honor-among-gods.

  • There  are  16 turns total, 8 for each player.
  • You may only lay down one tile each turn. 
  • Every interaction consists of an electron and a positron, and must have one arrow going in and  one  arrow going out.
  • If you split a photon (e.g., placing an electron at the end), you must use your next turn to complete the split (in this example, by placing a positron).

This game will be updated as we continue to develop it.
